other_tests.findings: Dense, nodular infiltrates of medium/large-sized atypical lymphoid cells in the dermis and subcutaneous tissue; tumor cells stained with T-cell markers CD3, CD4, CD5, CD25, and Ki-67(MIB-1), and failed to stain with CD8, CD20, CD30, CD56, CD68, granzyme B, ALK-1, or EMA.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No residual lymphoma cells in the skin were detected by histological examination after treatment.

other_tests.findings: Patient had antibodies to HTLV-1 using enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay and Western blotting.
Monoclonal integration of HTLV-1 proviral DNA was detected in the skin lesion; clonal T cell beta and gamma receptor gene rearrangements were detected.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Clonal integration of HTLV-1 proviral DNA in the peripheral blood was repeatedly negative.

other_tests.findings: Skin tumor completely resolved after treatment with 50 Gy x-ray and 6 Gy electron beam irradiation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No recurrence has been noted for 13 months.
